p: Overall, we are projecting substantial decreases of C. finmarchicus in the Northeast U.S. Shelf due to anthropogenic climate change by the end of the century. Mitigation is likely to only affect the magnitude of these changes, not the likelihood. This could have profound impacts on the North Atlantic right whale and many other economically and socially important species that are dependent on C. finmarchicus. However, more detailed projections involving species interactions and physical effects not considered here are still required in order to best assess the threat to C. finmarchicus on the Northeast U.S. Shelf.
